<rss version="2.0" xmlns:content="http://purl.org/rss/1.0/modules/content/">
	<channel>
		<title>New on MIT Technology Review</title>
		
		<link>https://www.technologyreview.com/stories.rss</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 07:43:25 GMT</pubDate>
		<description></description>
		<language>en</language>
		
			<image>
				<title>MIT Technology Review</title>
				<url>https://www.technologyreview.com/_/img/stacked-logo-125x61.png</url>
			</image>
		

		
			<item>
				<title>Seven Must-Read Stories (Week Ending May 14, 2016)</title>
				
					<description>Another chance to catch the most interesting, and important, articles from the previous week on <em>MIT Technology Review</em>.</description>
				
				<link>https://www.technologyreview.com/s/601438/seven-must-read-stories-week-ending-may-14-2016/</link>
				
					<guid isPermaLink="true">https://www.technologyreview.com/s/601438/seven-must-read-stories-week-ending-may-14-2016/</guid>
				
				<pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 13:00:00 GMT</pubDate>
				
				
			</item>
		
			<item>
				<title>Moore’s Law Is Dead. Now What?</title>
				
					<description>Shrinking transistors have powered 50 years of advances in computing—but now other ways must be found to make computers more capable.</description>
				
				<link>https://www.technologyreview.com/s/601441/moores-law-is-dead-now-what/</link>
				
					<guid isPermaLink="true">https://www.technologyreview.com/s/601441/moores-law-is-dead-now-what/</guid>
				
				<pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 04:00:00 GMT</pubDate>
				
				
			</item>
		
			<item>
				<title>Global Air Pollution Is Getting Worse, but Removing It Could Worsen Climate Change</title>
				
					<description>Airborne microscopic particles kill millions of people each year, but they also lessen some of the effects of man-made global warming.</description>
				
				<link>https://www.technologyreview.com/s/601455/global-air-pollution-is-getting-worse-but-removing-it-could-worsen-climate-change/</link>
				
					<guid isPermaLink="true">https://www.technologyreview.com/s/601455/global-air-pollution-is-getting-worse-but-removing-it-could-worsen-climate-change/</guid>
				
				<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 21:43:00 GMT</pubDate>
				
				
			</item>
		
			<item>
				<title>Google’s Algorithms Decode Language like a Trained Linguist</title>
				
					<description>The search company is releasing the secret sauce it uses to make sense of ambiguous language. It could help developers build apps that actually understand us.</description>
				
				<link>https://www.technologyreview.com/s/601440/googles-algorithms-decode-language-like-a-trained-linguist/</link>
				
					<guid isPermaLink="true">https://www.technologyreview.com/s/601440/googles-algorithms-decode-language-like-a-trained-linguist/</guid>
				
				<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 20:40:00 GMT</pubDate>
				
				
			</item>
		
			<item>
				<title>Small, Modular Nuclear Plants Get Their First Chance in the U.S.</title>
				
					<description>As traditional nuclear power remains stalled in the U.S., a utility in Tennessee seeks permission for a new type of reactor that could be cheaper to build and maintain.</description>
				
				<link>https://www.technologyreview.com/s/601426/small-modular-nuclear-plants-get-their-first-chance-in-the-us/</link>
				
					<guid isPermaLink="true">https://www.technologyreview.com/s/601426/small-modular-nuclear-plants-get-their-first-chance-in-the-us/</guid>
				
				<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 20:26:00 GMT</pubDate>
				
				
			</item>
		
			<item>
				<title>How to Make Passwords That Cannot Be Compromised by Torture or Coercion</title>
				
					<description>Your state of mind can reveal whether you are being forced to give up your password. So researchers are using this to build a coercion-resistant system of authentication.</description>
				
				<link>https://www.technologyreview.com/s/601445/how-to-make-passwords-that-cannot-be-compromised-by-torture-or-coercion/</link>
				
					<guid isPermaLink="true">https://www.technologyreview.com/s/601445/how-to-make-passwords-that-cannot-be-compromised-by-torture-or-coercion/</guid>
				
				<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 17:05:00 GMT</pubDate>
				
				
			</item>
		
			<item>
				<title>To Make Fresh Water without Warming the Planet, Countries Eye Solar Power</title>
				
					<description>Solar-powered desalination is ideal—if only the cost comes down.</description>
				
				<link>https://www.technologyreview.com/s/601419/to-make-fresh-water-without-warming-the-planet-countries-eye-solar-power/</link>
				
					<guid isPermaLink="true">https://www.technologyreview.com/s/601419/to-make-fresh-water-without-warming-the-planet-countries-eye-solar-power/</guid>
				
				<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 10:42:00 GMT</pubDate>
				
				
			</item>
		
			<item>
				<title>The Hyperloop’s Underwhelming First Public Test</title>
				
					<description>The propulsion system for a possible design for Elon Musk’s high-speed transit concept—the Hyperloop—got a test run in the Nevada desert.</description>
				
				<link>https://www.technologyreview.com/s/601427/the-hyperloops-underwhelming-first-public-test/</link>
				
					<guid isPermaLink="true">https://www.technologyreview.com/s/601427/the-hyperloops-underwhelming-first-public-test/</guid>
				
				<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 02:57:00 GMT</pubDate>
				
				
			</item>
		
			<item>
				<title>In Global Shift, Poorer Countries Are Increasingly the Early Tech Adopters</title>
				
					<description>In some corners of the world, the poorest populations are the first to benefit from new technologies that are improving health.</description>
				
				<link>https://www.technologyreview.com/s/601425/in-global-shift-poorer-countries-are-increasingly-the-early-tech-adopters/</link>
				
					<guid isPermaLink="true">https://www.technologyreview.com/s/601425/in-global-shift-poorer-countries-are-increasingly-the-early-tech-adopters/</guid>
				
				<pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 20:35:00 GMT</pubDate>
				
				
			</item>
		
			<item>
				<title>Oculus Says Over a Million People Used Gear VR Headsets in April</title>
				
					<description>People are watching lots of video with the mobile virtual-reality headset.</description>
				
				<link>https://www.technologyreview.com/s/601439/oculus-says-over-a-million-people-used-gear-vr-headsets-in-april/</link>
				
					<guid isPermaLink="true">https://www.technologyreview.com/s/601439/oculus-says-over-a-million-people-used-gear-vr-headsets-in-april/</guid>
				
				<pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 17:30:00 GMT</pubDate>
				
				
			</item>
		
	</channel>
</rss>
